In the 1980s, Chase transitioned to film, starring in a string of successful comedy classics, including "Caddyshack" (1980), "National Lampoon's Vacation" (1983), and "Fletch" (1985). His irreverent humor and physical comedy skills made him a household name, and he became synonymous with the phrase "Hey, buddy!"

Throughout his career, Chase has won numerous awards, including an Emmy, a Golden Globe, and a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Despite his many accolades, Chase remains humble and dedicated to his craft, continuing to perform stand-up and appear in films and TV shows to this day.

In the 1980s, Chevy transitioned to film, starring in a string of hit comedies, including "National Lampoon's Caddyshack," "Fletch," and "Spies Like Us." His witty one-liners, comedic timing, and goofy charm made him a beloved figure in American comedy.

Throughout his career, Chevy has won numerous awards, including multiple Emmy and Golden Globe nominations. He has also written several books and has been involved in various charitable organizations, using his platform to support causes close to his heart.
